sentences.en: Businesses need to train their workers better, and spend more on R&D.
sentences.cn: 各企业需要更好地培训工人，并且在研发方面加大投入。

sentences.en: Coleridge was to spend the next thirty years attacking rationalism.
sentences.cn: 柯尔律治在之后的30年里一直抨击理性主义。

sentences.en: He had to spend two years bedridden with an injury.
sentences.cn: 他因伤不得不卧床两年。

sentences.en: I can spend the whole day undisturbed at the warehouse.
sentences.cn: 我可以一整天都呆在仓库里而不受打扰。

sentences.en: I can’t afford to spend any more money this week.
sentences.cn: 这星期我没有能力花更多的钱了。

sentences.en: I spend a lot on expensive jewelry and clothing.
sentences.cn: 我花很多钱购买昂贵的首饰和衣服。

sentences.en: I spend all day running around after the family.
sentences.cn: 我一整天都跟着这家人跑来跑去。

sentences.en: It was obscene to spend millions producing unwanted food.
sentences.cn: 耗资数百万去生产一些不需要的食品，真是令人发指。

sentences.en: Kate had invited Alan to spend the Passover with her.
sentences.cn: 凯特已经邀请了艾伦和她一起过逾越节。

sentences.en: Novello says college students will spend $4.2 billion yearly on alcoholic beverages.
sentences.cn: 诺韦洛说大学生每年在酒精饮品上会消费掉42亿美元。

sentences.en: She probably had more money but she didn't spend it.
sentences.cn: 她或许有更多的钱，但是她没花过。

sentences.en: She would spend the day hanging round street corners.
sentences.cn: 她会整天在街角附近游荡.

sentences.en: The private sector, by contrast, has plenty of money to spend.
sentences.cn: 相比之下，私营部门就有很多钱可供开销。

sentences.en: The repairs cost a lot, but it’s money well spent (= a sensible way of spending money ) .
sentences.cn: 修理费很高，但这是该花的钱。

sentences.en: The shuttle will spend five days docked with Mir.
sentences.cn: 航天飞机将和和平号对接5天。

sentences.en: The six astronauts on board will spend ten days in space.
sentences.cn: 飞船上的6名宇航员将在太空度过10天。

sentences.en: They will then have more money to spend on other things.
sentences.cn: 这样他们就可以有更多的钱花在其他地方。

words.tran_cn: 挥金如土的人；挥霍者；用钱的人
花费；度过（spend的现在分词形式）
花费（spend的过去分词）；浪费；耗费

trans.tran_en: to use your money to pay for goods or services

trans.tran_cn: 花费， 浪费； 耗尽
trans.tran_en: to use your money to pay for goods or services
to use your money to pay for goods or services
